revised_title: Investigating the Limits of Telescopic Resolution and the Nature of Celestial Objects
tldr: Dr. William Herschel conducted a series of experiments to determine the limits of telescopic resolution and distinguish real from spurious diameters of celestial and terrestrial objects. He found that a ten-feet reflector can show the real or spurious discs of objects when their diameter is one-fourth of a second, and in favorable conditions, this diameter can be divided into two or three parts. The study has implications for improving the criteria for observing celestial objects.
